The painting is highly detailed, with intricate textures and patterns visible in the clothing and background elements. The style is characteristic of Northern Renaissance art, with a focus on realism and attention to detail. The background includes architectural elements and additional figures, suggesting a complex narrative scene. The use of light and shadow is sophisticated, enhancing the three-dimensional effect of the figures. The overall composition and technique suggest the work of a master painter from the early 16th century, known for their contributions to Flemish art.
